main_definition: To renew or invigorate something, often by making it look fresh again or giving new energy to a tired mind.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To revive the appearance of (something) so that it looks cleaner and brighter.
meanings_and_examples.example: After cleaning my computer screen, I can see everything much better because it's refreshed.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To renew an expired or outdated document or permit.
meanings_and_examples.example: I had to refresh my driver's license after it was about to expire.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To give new energy or vitality to someone who is feeling tired or worn out.
meanings_and_examples.example: After a short nap, I felt refreshed and ready to tackle the rest of my day's tasks.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In computing, to update information displayed on a screen by reloading data from a source file or database.
meanings_and_examples.example: I clicked 'refresh' on the webpage to see if any new messages had appeared in my chat box.
